template_item.description: A template item, consisting of a block name, an object of block attributes, and an array of inner blocks. Inner blocks are in the same format as a template-item and allows infinite recursion.

label.description: Name of the post type shown in the menu. Usually plural.

labels.description: An array of labels for this post type. If not set, post labels are inherited for non-hierarchical types and page labels for hierarchical ones. See [get_post_type_labels()](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_post_type_labels/) for a full list of supported labels.

name.description: General name for the post type, usually plural. The same and overridden by $post_type_object->label. Default is ‘Posts’ / ‘Pages’.

singular_name.description: Name for one object of this post type. Default is ‘Post’ / ‘Page’.

add_new.description: Default is ‘Add New’ for both hierarchical and non-hierarchical types.

add_new_item.description: Label for adding a new singular item. Default is ‘Add New Post’ / ‘Add New Page’.

edit_item.description: Label for editing a singular item. Default is ‘Edit Post’ / ‘Edit Page’.

new_item.description: Label for the new item page title. Default is ‘New Post’ / ‘New Page’.

view_item.description: Label for viewing a singular item. Default is ‘View Post’ / ‘View Page’.

view_items.description: Label for viewing post type archives. Default is ‘View Posts’ / ‘View Pages’.

search_items.description: Label for searching plural items. Default is ‘Search Posts’ / ‘Search Pages’.

not_found.description: Label displayed when no posts are found. Default is ‘No posts found’ / ‘No pages found’.

not_found_in_trash.description: Label displayed when no posts are in the trash. Default is ‘No posts found in Trash’ / ‘No pages found in Trash’.

parent_item_colon.description: Label used to prefix parents of hierarchical items. Not used on non-hierarchical post types. Default is ‘Parent Page:’.

all_items.description: Label to signify all items in a submenu link. Default is ‘All Posts’ / ‘All Pages’.

archives.description: Label for archives in nav menus. Default is ‘Post Archives’ / ‘Page Archives’.

attributes.description: Label for the attributes meta box. Default is ‘Post Attributes’ / ‘Page Attributes’.

insert_into_item.description: Label for inserting a single item into a parent. Default is ‘Insert into post’ / ‘Insert into page’.

uploaded_to_this_item.description: Label for the media frame filter. Default is ‘Uploaded to this post’ / ‘Uploaded to this page’.

featured_image.description: Label for the featured image meta box title. Default is ‘Featured Image’.

set_featured_image.description: Label for setting the featured image. Default is ‘Set featured image’.

remove_featured_image.description: Label for removing the featured image. Default is ‘Remove featured image’.

use_featured_image.description: Label in the media frame for using a featured image. Default is ‘Use as featured image’.

menu_name.description: Label for the menu name. Default is the same as `name`.

filter_items_list.description: Label for the table views hidden heading.

filter_by_date.description: Label for the date filter in the table view.

items_list_navigation.description: Label for the table pagination hidden heading.

items_list.description: Label for the table hidden heading.

item_published.description: Label used when an item is published. Default is ‘Post published.’ / ‘Page published.’

item_published_privately.description: Label used when an item is published with private visibility. Default is ‘Post published privately.’ / ‘Page published privately.’

item_reverted_to_draft.description: Label used when an item is switched to a draft. Default is ‘Post reverted to draft.’ / ‘Page reverted to draft.’

item_trashed.description: Label used when an item is sent to the trash. Default is ‘Post trashed.’ / ‘Page trashed.’

item_scheduled.description: Label used when an item is scheduled for publishing. Default is ‘Post scheduled.’ / ‘Page scheduled.’

item_updated.description: Label used when an item is updated. Default is ‘Post updated.’ / ‘Page updated.’

item_link.description: Title for a navigation link block variation. Default is ‘Post Link’ / ‘Page Link’.

item_link_description.description: Description for a navigation link block variation. Default is ‘A link to a post.’ / ‘A link to a page.’

description.description: A short descriptive summary of what the post type is.

public.description: Whether a post type is intended for use publicly either via the admin interface or by front-end users. While the default settings of $exclude_from_search, $publicly_queryable, $show_ui, and $show_in_nav_menus are inherited from $public, each does not rely on this relationship and controls a very specific intention.

hierarchical.description: Whether the post type is hierarchical (e.g. page)

exclude_from_search.description: Whether to exclude posts with this post type from front end search results. Default is the opposite value of $public.

publicly_queryable.description: Whether queries can be performed on the front end for the post type as part of parse_request(). Endpoints would include: * ?post_type={post_type_key} * ?{post_type_key}={single_post_slug} * ?{post_type_query_var}={single_post_slug} If not set, the default is inherited from $public.

show_ui.description: Whether to generate and allow a UI for managing this post type in the admin. Default is value of $public.

show_in_menu.desciption: Where to show the post type in the admin menu. To work, $show_ui must be true. If true, the post type is shown in its own top level menu. If false, no menu is shown. If a string of an existing top level menu ('tools.php' or 'edit.php?post_type=page', for example), the post type will be placed as a sub-menu of that.

show_in_nav_menus.description: Makes this post type available for selection in navigation menus.

show_in_admin_bar.description: Makes this post type available via the admin bar. Default is value of $show_in_menu

show_in_rest.description: Whether to include the post type in the REST API. Set this to true for the post type to be available in the block editor.

rest_base.description: To change the base URL of REST API route. Default is $post_type.

rest_namespace.description: To change the namespace of REST API route. Default is $rest_base.

rest_controller_class.description: REST API Controller class name. Default is 'WP_REST_Posts_Controller'.

menu_position.description: The position in the menu order the post type should appear. To work, $show_in_menu must be true. Default null (at the bottom).

menu_icon.description: The URL to the icon to be used for this menu. Pass a base64-encoded SVG using a data URI, which will be colored to match the color scheme -- this should begin with 'data:image/svg+xml;base64,'. Pass the name of a Dashicons helper class to use a font icon, e.g. 'dashicons-chart-pie'. Pass 'none' to leave div.wp-menu-image empty so an icon can be added via CSS. Defaults to use the posts icon.

capability_type.description: The string to use to build the read, edit, and delete capabilities. May be passed as an array to allow for alternative plurals when using this argument as a base to construct the capabilities, e.g. array('story', 'stories'). Default 'post'.

capabilities.description: Array of capabilities for this post type. $capability_type is used as a base to construct capabilities by default.

edit_post.description: Capability required to edit this post type.

read_post.description: Capability required to read this post type.

delete_post.description: Capability required to delete this post type.

edit_posts.description: Capability required to edit posts of this post type.

edit_others_posts.description: Capability required to edit others posts of this post type.

delete_posts.description: Capability required to delete posts of this post type.

publish_posts.description: Capability required to publish posts of this post type.

read_private_posts.description: Capability required to read private posts of this post type.

map_meta_cap.description: Whether to use the internal default meta capability handling.

supports.description: Core feature(s) the post type supports. Serves as an alias for calling add_post_type_support() directly.

taxonomies.description: An array of taxonomy identifiers that will be registered for the post type. Taxonomies can be registered later with register_taxonomy() or register_taxonomy_for_object_type() .

has_archive.description: Whether there should be post type archives, or if a string, the archive slug to use. Will generate the proper rewrite rules if $rewrite is enabled. Default false.

rewrite.description: Triggers the handling of rewrites for this post type. To prevent rewrite, set to false. Defaults to true, using $post_type as slug. To specify rewrite rules, an object can be passed.

slug.description: Customize the permastruct slug. Defaults to $post_type key.

with_front.description: Whether the permastruct should be prepended with WP_Rewrite::$front.

feeds.description: Whether the feed permastruct should be built for this post type. Default is value of $has_archive.

pages.description: Whether the permastruct should provide for pagination. Default true.

query_var.description: Sets the query_var key for this post type. Defaults to $post_type key. If false, a post type cannot be loaded at ?{query_var}={post_slug}. If specified as a string, the query ?{query_var_string}={post_slug} will be valid.

can_export.description: Whether to allow this post type to be exported. Default true.

delete_with_user.description: Whether to delete posts of this type when deleting a user. If true, posts of this type belonging to the user will be moved to Trash when the user is deleted. If false, posts of this type belonging to the user will *not* be trashed or deleted. If not set (the default), posts are trashed if post type supports the 'author' feature. Otherwise posts are not trashed or deleted.

template.description: An array of template-items to be used as the default template for this post type. A template item is defined as an array/tuple of block-name, attributes, and an array of inner blocks.

template_lock.description: Whether the block template should be locked if $template is set

labels.description: An array of labels for this taxonomy. If not set, taxonomy labels are inherited from post type labels. See [get_taxonomy_labels()](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_taxonomy_labels/) for a full list of supported labels.

name.description: General name for the taxonomy, usually plural. The same and overridden by $taxonomy_object->label. Default is ‘Tags’ / ‘Categories’.

singular_name.description: Name for one object of this taxonomy. Default is ‘Tag’ / ‘Category’.

parent_item.description: This string isn’t used on non-hierarchical taxonomies. In hierarchical ones the default is ‘Parent Category’.

parent_item_colon.description: The same as parent_item, but with colon : in the end.

name_field_description.description: Description for the name field for this taxonomy.

slug_field_description.description: Description for the slug field for this taxonomy.

parent_field_description.description: Description for the parent field for this taxonomy.

add_new_item.description: Default is ‘Add New Tag’ / ‘Add New Category’.

new_item_name.description: Default is ‘New Tag Name’ / ‘New Category Name’.

separate_items_with_commas.description: This string isn’t used on hierarchical taxonomies. In non-hierarchical ones the default is ‘Separate tags with commas.’

add_or_remove_items.description: Default is ‘Add or remove tags’ / ‘Add or remove categories’.

choose_from_most_used.description: Default is ‘Choose from the most used tags’ / ‘Choose from the most used categories’.

not_found.description: Default is ‘No tags found’ / ‘No categories found’.

filter_by_item.description: This label is only used for hierarchical taxonomies. Default ‘Filter by category’, used in the posts list table.

items_list_navigation.description: Label for the table pagination hidden heading.

items_list.description: Label for the table hidden heading.

most_used.description: Title for the most used terms.

back_to_items.description: Title for the back to items link.

item_link.description: Title for a navigation link block variation. Default is ‘Tag Link’ / ‘Category Link’.

item_link_description.description: Description for a navigation link block variation. Default is ‘A link to a tag.’ / ‘A link to a category.’

description.description: A short descriptive summary of what the taxonomy is.

public.description: Whether a taxonomy is intended for use publicly either via the admin interface or by front-end users. The default settings of $show_ui, $show_in_nav_menus, and $show_tagcloud are inherited from $public.

publicly_queryable.description: Whether the taxonomy is publicly queryable.

show_ui.description: Whether to generate and allow a UI for managing terms in this taxonomy in the admin.

show_in_menu.description: Where to show the taxonomy in the admin menu. To work, $show_ui must be true. If true, the taxonomy is shown in its own top level menu. If false, no menu is shown. If a string of an existing top level menu ('tools.php' or 'edit.php?post_type=page', for example), the taxonomy will be placed as a sub-menu of that.

show_in_nav_menus.description: Makes this taxonomy available for selection in navigation menus.

show_in_rest.description: Whether to include the taxonomy in the REST API. Set this to true for the taxonomy to be available in the block editor.

rest_base.description: To change the base URL of REST API route. Default is $taxonomy.

rest_namespace.description: To change the namespace URL of REST API route. Default is wp/v2.

rest_controller_class.description: REST API Controller class name. Default is 'WP_REST_Terms_Controller'.

show_tagcloud.description: Whether to list the taxonomy in the Tag Cloud Widget control.

show_in_quick_edit.description: Whether to show the taxonomy in the quick/bulk edit panel.

show_admin_column.description: Whether to display a column for the taxonomy on its post type listing screens.

meta_box_cb.description: Provide a callback function name for the meta box display. Default is post_categories_meta_box() or post_tags_meta_box() .

capabilities.description: Array of capabilities for this taxonomy.

manage_terms.description: Capability required to manage terms of this taxonomy.

edit_terms.description: Capability required to edit terms of this taxonomy.

delete_terms.description: Capability required to delete terms of this taxonomy.

assign_terms.description: Capability required to assign terms of this taxonomy.

rewrite.description: Triggers the handling of rewrites for this taxonomy. To prevent rewrite, set to false. Defaults to true, using $taxonomy as slug. To specify rewrite rules, an array can be passed.

slug.description: Customize the permastruct slug. Defaults to $taxonomy key.

with_front.description: Whether the permastruct should be prepended with WP_Rewrite::$front.

query_var.description: Sets the query_var key for this taxonomy. Defaults to $taxonomy key. If false, a taxonomy cannot be loaded at ?{query_var}={term_slug}. If specified as a string, the query ?{query_var_string}={term_slug} will be valid.

update_count_callback.description: A function name that will be called when the count of an associated $object_type changes. Default is _update_post_term_count().

default_term.description: Default term to be used for this taxonomy. Default is the first term.

sort.description: Whether this taxonomy should remember the order in which terms are added to objects.

args.description: Array of arguments to automatically use inside wp_get_object_terms() for this taxonomy.

hide_empty.description: Whether to hide terms not assigned to any posts.

include.description: Array of term IDs to include.

exclude.description: Array of term IDs to exclude.

exclude_tree.description: Array of term IDs to exclude along with their descendants.

number.description: Maximum number of terms to return.

offset.description: The number by which to offset the terms query.

count.description: Whether to return a term count.

name.description: Name or array of names to return term(s) for.

slug.description: Slug or array of slugs to return term(s) for.

term_taxonomy_id.description: Term taxonomy ID or array of IDs to return term(s) for.

hierarchical.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants.

pad_counts.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term’s children in the quantity of each term’s children.

child_of.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of.

parent.description: Parent term ID to retrieve child terms of.

childless.description: Whether to return terms that have no children.

cache_domain.description: Unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in an object cache.

cache_results.description: Whether to cache term information. Default true.

update_term_meta_cache.description: Whether to prime meta caches for matched terms. Default true.

meta_key.description: Meta key or keys to filter by.

meta_type.description: MySQL data type that the meta_value column will be CAST to for comparisons.

meta_type_key.description: MySQL data type that the meta_key column will be CAST to for comparisons
